meanings.definition: A person who openly declares or asserts something.
meanings.sent1: The avowers of the truth were praised for their honesty.
meanings.sent2: The courtroom was filled with avowers who shared their experiences.
meanings.sent3: The avowers at the meeting made sure their voices were heard.
meanings.sent4: She stood out as an avower of justice in the community.
meanings.sent5: The avowers of change inspired others to speak up.

meanings.definition: To openly acknowledge or declare something.
meanings.sent1: He avowers his love for music by playing the guitar every day.
meanings.sent2: She avowers her support for the cause by attending all the rallies.
meanings.sent3: The cat avowers its hunger by meowing loudly near the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The artist avowers her emotions through her vibrant paintings.
meanings.sent5: The student avowers his dedication to learning by studying late into the night.
